item.title: Watchlists from The Movie Database
item.description: 1: API token for read access (v4 auth) Get API token on The Movie Database. Saved in local storage. 2: Get Watchlists (Mabye initilize to get a access token) Initialize Get Watchlists 3: Filter Provider with flatrate Movies Accept request token Confirm request token in new window for the access token from The Movie Database! Token confirmed

item.title: Trello tools
item.description: Delete archived cards on a trello board. Generate API key and token in Trello API key for developers. (Revoke token: Trello > Account > Applications) 1. Authorize API key API token Initialize 2. Board actions Board: List archived (Interactive) Remove archived (Just remove all) Status output:

item.title: Bitwarden to printer
item.description: Converts a JSON export from Bitwarden into a printable document. Converter Website

item.title: Password manager
item.description: Password manager I would recommend Bitwarden and it would be best to also use an authenticator. Bitwarden (Free/Premium) KeePass (Free) Authenticator Authy or Google mostly suitable for the first access. Bitwarden Authenticator (TOTP) is only available for Premium. Authy (Free) Google Authentificator (Free) Bitwarden Authenticator (TOTP) (Premium) Switching off the password manager in Firefox Firefox > Settings > Privacy & Security > Credentials and Passwords Asking whether access data and passwords for websites should be saved = no I want to know more Why a password manager?

item.title: Open the lever chest in Torghast
item.description: In the game World of Warcraft there is a lever chest in the dungeon Torghast. To open the chest, you have to go through all possible combinations and one combination opens the box. The 0 for lever is down and the 1 for lever is up. Simply put, you have to go through all of the binary codes: 0000000100100011 0100010101100111 1000100110101011 1100110111101111 Too difficult to remember? It is easier with this memory aid: >1, <2, repeat once
